prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.1642, 0.0]. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Draw a circle centered at [0.3209, 0.3209] with a radius of 0.3209 to complete loop 1. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.6417. Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by 0.1642 units, creating a new solid body. **Part 2: Tapered Rectangular Prism** Create a new coordinate system with the same euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector [0.0463, 0.1642, 0.3209]. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Draw line 1 from point [0.0, 0.0] to [0.548, 0.0]. Draw line 2 from point [0.548, 0.0] to [0.548, 0.2133]. Draw line 3 from point [0.548, 0.2133] to [0.548, 0.4266]. Draw line 4 from point [0.548, 0.4266] to [0.0, 0.4266]. Close the loop by connecting line 1's endpoint to its starting point. Create a new sketch on face 2 of the coordinate system. Draw line 5 from point [0.548, 0.2133] to [0.7037, 0.2133]. Draw line 6 from point [0.7037, 0.2133] to [0.7037, 0.4266]. Draw line 7 from point [0.7037, 0.4266] to [0.548, 0.4266]. Close the loop by connecting line 5's endpoint to its starting point. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.7037. Extrude the first sketch along the normal direction by 0.1293 units. Perform a join operation with the previously created solid body. The final shape will be a three-dimensional, cylindrical shape with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The dimensions of the first part are length 0.6417, width 0.1642, and height 0.6417. The second part has dimensions length 0.7037, width 0.1293, and height 0.7037.</description>

The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, and the middle section is slightly narrower than the top and bottom.
